step1.sentence: The hotel staff went the extra mile, leaving a personalized welcome note and flowers in our room.

step2.story: Most candidates submitted their portfolio as a PDF link. Hana went the extra mile and built a custom interactive website that loaded differently depending on which role she was applying for. She got three callbacks from four applications.

step3.story: The small repair shop had modest equipment and a modest reputation. What kept customers returning year after year was the owner's habit of going the extra mile in small, unscripted ways — calling to check in a week after a repair, noticing a different problem and fixing it for free, or simply remembering a customer's name and the story behind the item they had brought in. None of these things cost much money. Taken together, they built a loyalty that no marketing budget could replicate. When a chain competitor opened a block away, not a single regular customer switched.

meaning.realUsageKo: 기대 이상의 노력이나 배려를 기울일 때 씁니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 성경 마태복음에서 유래한 표현으로, 1마일을 강제로 가야 할 때 2마일을 자발적으로 가라는 가르침에서 나왔습니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 특별한 헌신이나 서비스 정신을 칭찬할 때 자주 씁니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: She always goes the extra mile for her students.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 그녀는 항상 학생들을 위해 특별한 노력을 기울여요.
